intro: Trembleya stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trembleya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
